definition: (TCM) six excesses causing illness, namely: excessive wind 風|风[feng1], cold 寒[han2], heat 暑[shu3], damp 濕|湿[shi1], dryness 燥[zao4], fire 火[huo3]
six/6
variant of 淫[yin2]
excess/excessive/wanton/lewd/lascivious/obscene/depraved
(TCM) six unhealthy influences causing illness, namely: excessive wind 風|风[feng1], cold 寒[han2], heat 暑[shu3], damp 濕|湿[shi1], dryness 燥[zao4], fire 火[huo3]
pathogenic influence (TCM)
pathogeny (cause of disease) in TCM/as opposed to vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4]
"eight principles," a method of giving a general description and syndrome differentiation (TCM)
pattern-syndrome identification based on the eight principles (TCM)
inner organs
localized pain disorder (in Chinese medicine)/arthralgia syndrome/bi disorder
interpretation of the cause/onset and process of an illness/pathogenesis
half outside, half inside/half interior, half exterior
latent (desire, feeling etc)/bottled up
superficial syndrome/illness that has not attacked the vital organs of the human body
five viscera of TCM, namely: heart 心[xin1], liver 肝[gan1], spleen 脾[pi2], lungs 肺[fei4] and kidneys 腎|肾[shen4]
twelve channels of TCM

(TCM) six bowels (hollow organs), namely: gall bladder 膽|胆[dan3], stomach 胃[wei4], large intestine 大腸|大肠[da4 chang2], small intestine 小腸|小肠[xiao3 chang2], triple heater 三焦[san1 jiao1], bladder 膀胱[pang2 guang1]
name of disease in TCM
traditional Chinese medicine/TCM
